title: The Indus Valley Mystery
description: A quick, practical guide to The Indus Valley Mystery.

hook.text: A civilization of five million people had flush toilets 4,500 years ago. Then it vanished without a trace.

buildup.text: The Indus Valley civilization had grid-planned cities, sewage systems, and standard weights and measures.

discovery.text: Mohenjo-daro and Harappa were its twin capitals. No palaces or temples have been found â€” a true mystery.

twist.text: Their writing has never been deciphered. Over 400 symbols exist, but no one knows what they say.

climax.text: Climate change likely killed it. The monsoon shifted, rivers dried up, and the cities were abandoned.

punchline.text: An advanced civilization vanished, and we still can't read their writing.

quiz.question: What is still undeciphered about the Indus Valley civilization?
